cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 mi S of Panama City, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest through the east-central Gulf, then curving northeast toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Panama City–Florida Big Bend area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Chassahowitzka to Anna Maria Island FL, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from AL/FL border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Warning Suwannee River to Chassahowitzka FL; Storm-Surge Warning Okaloosa/Walton Co. Line to Anclote River FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast from Alabama through Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, with surge/watch area extending southward to Tampa Bay region
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (forecast 2-4 ft for Tampa Bay to Anna Maria Island)
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in and near Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee terminals
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized totals up to 6 inches could cause ponding and minor flooding on the port grounds
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas
